intro: Phyllorkis clavophylis, commonly known as the broad-leafed rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Its leaves are broad and leathery, and it produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes.
